title: Making Every Electron Count: Strategies for Electron Ptychography at Low Fluence
content: Acquisition of a ptychographic dataset typically requires the collection of a series of far field diffraction patterns as a function of probe position at the specimen plane. This can then be used to recover the complex specimen object function using either iterative or non-iterative algorithms. Importantly, ptychography is an inherently dose efficient technique, enabling effective the reconstruction of the exit wavefunction of radiation sensitive objects.
